column5: My son and I plan to go to the French River this Saturday. He is developmentally disabled and doesn't have a passport. He's never needed one before as he has a state issued ID and birth certificate. As I was attempting to do the ARRIVCAN thing online for him, I find you cannot proceed without a passport number. I called the inquiries number provided and the guy who answered said if he is an adult he must have a passport. I tried calling the Ontario border folks at the SOO (where we cross) and could not get a live person to talk to. So, we are just going to try to cross and see what happens. However, if we are denied entry, I am thinking we will try to find some lodges in the UP, preferably American Plan. Does anyone have any suggestions? Thanks in advance.
Only places that may have what your looking for that I am aware of will be on Gogebic. Good luck
I would say lake gogebic also. Should be good this time of year.
The Root Cellar on Gogebic is nice and has a restaurant. Not sure about American Plan though. There's also AJ's Walleye Lodge on Gogebic. http://walleyelodge.com/?fbclid=IwAR...YuhQwdIGB-Lgpo
